document_data.caption: A map of Tabot showing Nam Tso in the bottom left; the Wohani River is the western tributary.
document_data.name: Wohani River
document_data.mainbody: The '''Wohani River''' was a river in the [[Po Yul Dzayul Range]] in [[Phutan]] and [[Tabot]].
document_data.Geography: Joined by a tributary, the Wohani River had its headwaters in the Po Yul Dzayul Range, near where the range joined the [[Haraki Ridge]]. It flowed south through the foothills, crossing the border between the nations of Phutan and Tabot, before emptying into [[Nam Tso]]. The lake was also fed by the [[Nam River]], which emerged from the range further to the south. The Wohani River was known for its misty trails and it was overlooked by [[Hoshki Gompa]].
